register.description: CONTROL REGISTER - Context This register controls the Context. This register is shadowed: modifications are taken into account after the next FSC sync code.

bitfield.description: Allows swapping bytes two by two in the payload data.It doesn't affect - short packets- long packet header or footers- CRC calculationThe purpose is to by swap data send to the Interconnect port and/or video port
Enables the generic mode.

bitenum.description: Disabled.Data is received according to CSI2_CTX_CTRL1.FORMAT andthe long packet code transmitted in the MIPI stream is used.
Enabled.Data is received according to CSI2_CTX_CTRL1.FORMAT andthe long packet code transmitted in the MIPI stream is ignored.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.

Enables image transcoding.When this features is enabled:- the data format from the camera is defined by the FORMAT register- the format after transcode is defined by the TRANSCODE register. The memory storage / video port formats is defined by the TRANSCODE register

bitenum.description: Outputs DPCM compressed RAW10 data.After compression, pixels are coded on 8 bits.Data in memory is organized as regular RAW8 data
Outputs DPCM compressed RAW12 data.After compression, pixels are coded on 8 bits.Data in memory is organized as regular RAW8 data
Outputs ALAW compressed RAW10 data.After compression, pixels are coded on 8 bits.Data in memory is organized as regular RAW8 data.
Outputs uncompressed RAW8 data.Data in memory is organized as regular RAW8 data
Outputs uncompressed RAW10 data.Data in memory is organized as regular RAW10+EXP16 data
Outputs uncompressed RAW10 data.Data in memory is organized as regular packed RAW10 data
Outputs uncompressed RAW12 data.Data in memory is organized as regular RAW12+EXP16 data
Outputs uncompressed RAW12 data.Data in memory is organized as regular packed RAW12 data

bitfield.description: Number of FEC to receive between using swap of CSI2_CTX_DAT_PING_ADDR and CSI2_CTX_DAT_PONG_ADDR for the calculation of the address in memory. (shall be used only in interlace mode, otherwise set to '1')

Sets the number of frame to acquire. Once the frame acquisition starts, the COUNT value is decremented after every frame. When COUNT reaches 0, the FRAME_NUMBER_IRQ interrupt is triggered and CTX_EN is set to '0'. Writes to this bit field are controlled by the COUNT_UNLOCK bit. During the same Interconnect write access , the bit-field COUNT_UNLOCK shall be written in addition to COUNT bit-field in order to change the COUNT value. COUNT can be overwritten dynamically with a new count value.' 0: Infinite number of frames (no count).1: 1 frame to acquire...255: 255 frames to acquire.
Indicates if the end of frame signal shall be asserted at the end of the line.

bitenum.description: The end of frame signal is not asserted at the end of each frame.
The end of frame signal is asserted at the end of each frame.

bitfield.description: Indicates if the end of line signal shall be asserted at the end of the line.

bitenum.description: The end of line signal is not asserted at the end of each frame.
The end of line signal is asserted at the end of each frame.

bitfield.description: Enables the checksum check for the received payload (long packet only).
Unlock writes to the COUNT bit field.

bitenum.description: COUNT bit field is locked. Writes have no effect
COUNT bit field is unlocked. Writes are possible.

bitfield.description: Indicates whether the PING or PONG destination address (CSI2_CTX_DAT_PING_ADDR or CSI2_CTX_DAT_PONG_ADDR) was used to write the last frame.This bit field toggles after every FEC_NUMBER FEC sync code received for the current context.

Forces sending of the data to both VPORT and Interconnect.Only applies to formats that existing in 2 versions:- one sending data to Interconnect port only- one sending data to VPORTonly (tagged with the +VP extension) The format version sending data only to Interconnect should be choosen.
Line modulo configuration

bitenum.description: CSI2_CTX_CTRL3.LINE_NUMBER is used once per frame for the generation of the LINE_NUMBER_IRQ.
CSI2_CTX_CTRL3.LINE_NUMBER is used as a modulo number for the generation of the LINE_NUMBER_IRQ (multiple times the interrupt can be generated for each frame)

bitfield.description: Enables the Context

Sets the number of frame to acquire. Once the frame acquisition starts, the COUNT value is decremented after every frame. When COUNT reaches 0, the FRAME_NUMBER_IRQ interrupt is triggered and CTX_EN is set to '0'. Writes to this bit field are controlled by the COUNT_UNLOCK bit. During the same Interconnect write access , the bit-field COUNT_UNLOCK shall be written in addition to COUNT bit-field in order to change the COUNT value. COUNT can be overwritten dynamically with a new count value.' 0: Infinite number of frames (no count).1: 1 frame to acquire...255: 255 frames to acquire.
Indicates if the end of frame signal shall be asserted at the end of the line.

bitenum.description: The end of frame signal is not asserted at the end of each frame.
The end of frame signal is asserted at the end of each frame.

bitfield.description: Indicates if the end of line signal shall be asserted at the end of the line.

bitenum.description: The end of line signal is not asserted at the end of each frame.
The end of line signal is asserted at the end of each frame.

bitfield.description: Enables the checksum check for the received payload (long packet only).
Unlock writes to the COUNT bit field.

bitenum.description: COUNT bit field is locked. Writes have no effect
COUNT bit field is unlocked. Writes are possible.

bitfield.description: Indicates whether the PING or PONG destination address (CSI2_CTX_DAT_PING_ADDR or CSI2_CTX_DAT_PONG_ADDR) was used to write the last frame.This bit field toggles after every FEC_NUMBER FEC sync code received for the current context.

Forces sending of the data to both VPORT and Interconnect.Only applies to formats that existing in 2 versions:- one sending data to Interconnect port only- one sending data to VPORTonly (tagged with the +VP extension) The format version sending data only to Interconnect should be choosen.
Line modulo configuration

bitenum.description: CSI2_CTX_CTRL3.LINE_NUMBER is used once per frame for the generation of the LINE_NUMBER_IRQ.
CSI2_CTX_CTRL3.LINE_NUMBER is used as a modulo number for the generation of the LINE_NUMBER_IRQ (multiple times the interrupt can be generated for each frame)

bitfield.description: Enables the Context

register.description: CONTROL REGISTER - Context This register controls the Context. This register is shadowed: modifications are taken into account after the next FSC sync code (except for VIRTUAL_ID and FORMAT fields). The change of VIRTUIAL_ID and FORMAT has to occur only when the context is disabled (CSI2_CTX_CTRL1.CTX_EN).

Selects the DPCM predictor.

register.description: DATA MEM ADDRESS OFFSET REGISTER - Context This register sets the offset, which is applied on the destination address after each line is written to memory. This register applies for both and . For example, it enables to perform 2D data transfers of the pixel data into a frame buffer. In such case, the pixel data and frame buffer data shall have the same data format. Note that the 5 LSBs are ignored: the offset shall be a multiple of 32 bytes. This register is shadowed: modifications are taken into account after the next FSC sync code. Only full 32-bit values shall be written.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.

Line offset programmed in bytes (signed value 2's complement). If OFST = 0, the data is written contiguously in memory. Otherwise, OFST sets the destination offset between the first pixel of the previous line and the first pixel of the current line.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.

register.description: DATA MEM PING ADDRESS REGISTER - Context This register sets the 32-bit memory address where the pixel data are stored. The destination is double buffered: this register sets the PING address. Double buffering is enabled when the addresses and are different. Note that the 5 LSBs are ignored: the address shall be aligned on a 32-byte boundary. This register is shadowed: modifications are taken into account after the next FSC sync code. Only full 32-bit values shall be written.

register.description: MODULE REVISION This register contains the IP revision code in binary coded digital. For example, 0x01 = revision 0.1 and 0x21 = revision 2.1

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.
IP revision [7:4] Major revision[3:0] Minor revision

register.description: SYSTEM CONFIGURATION REGISTER This register is the Interconnect-socket system configuration register.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Sets the behavior of the master port power management signals.

bitenum.description: Force-standby. MStandby is only asserted when the module is disabled.
Smart-standby: MStandby is asserted based on the activity of the module. The module will try to go to standby during the vertical blanking period.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Software reset. Set the bit to 1 to trigger a module reset. The bit is automatically reset by the hw. During reads return 0.
Internal Interconnect gating strategy

bitenum.description: Automatic Interconnect clock gating strategy is applied based on the Interconnect interface activity.

register.description: SYSTEM STATUS REGISTER This register provides status information about the module, excluding the interrupt status register.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0..
Internal reset monitoring

bitenum.description: Internal module reset is on going.

register.description: INTERRUPT STATUS REGISTER - All contexts This register associates one bit for each context in order to determine which context has generated the interrupt. The context shall be enabled for events to be generated on that context.If the context is disabled, the interrupt is not generated.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Interconnect Error Interrupt

READS: Event is true (pending).WRITES: Status bit is reset.

register.description: GLOBAL CONTROL REGISTER This register controls the CSI2 RECEIVER module. This register shall not be modified dynamically (except IF_EN bit field).

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
VP clock enable.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
VP only enable.

bitenum.description: The VP is enabled and the Interconnect master port is enabled.
The VP is enabled and the Interconnect master port is disabled.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Video port output clock control. Sets the video port output clock as a function of the interface clock (OCPCLK).

bitenum.description: Division by 2: video port clock = OCPCLK / 2.
Division by 3: video port clock = OCPCLK / 3.
Division by 4: video port clock = OCPCLK / 4. Note: Software must change the reset value that is not appropriate.

bitfield.description: Enables the debug mode.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Select endianness for YUV422 8 bit and YUV420 legacy formats.

bitenum.description: Use native MIPI CSI2 endianness:Little endian for all formats except for YUV422 8b and YUV420 Legacy which a big endian.
Store all pixel formats little endian.

bitfield.description: Set the modality in which IF_EN works.

bitenum.description: If IF_EN = 0 the interface is disabled immediately.
If IF_EN = 1 the interface is disabled after all FEC sync code have been received for the active contexts.

bitfield.description: Enables the Error Correction Code check for the received header (short and long packets for all virtual channel ids).
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Enables the physical interface to the module.

bitenum.description: The interface is disabled. If FRAME = 0, it is disabled immediately. If FRAME = 1, it is disabled when each context has received the FEC sync code.

The interface is enabled immediately, the data acquisition starts on the next FSC sync code. Writing '1' to this register when the current value is '0' has the effect to clear the output FIFO. The pixel data of the following frame will be written in the PING buffer, i.e., the CSI2_CTX_CTRL.PING_PONG bits are reset to '0' as well.

register.description: DEBUG REGISTER (Header) This register provides a way to debug the CSI2 RECEIVER module with no image sensor connected to the module. The debug mode is enabled by .DBG_EN. Only full 32-bit values shall be written. The register is used to write short packets and header of long packets.

bitfield.description: 32-bit input value.

register.description: GENERIC PARAMETER REGISTER This register provide a way to read the generic parameters used in the design.

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility.Reads returns 0.
Output FIFO size in multiple of 68 bits.
Number of contexts supported by the module.

register.description: PHY configuration register for the PHY associated to the receiver This register contains the lane configuration for the order and position of the lanes (clock and data) and the polarity order for the control of the PHY differential signals in addition to the control bit for the power FSM.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Controls the reset of the PHY
Internal reset monitoring of the power domain using the PPI byte clock from the PHY

bitenum.description: Internal module reset is on going.

bitfield.description: Command for power control of the PHY

bitenum.description: Command to change to OFF state
Command to change to ON state
Command to change to Ultra Low Power state

bitfield.description: Status of the power control of the PHY

bitenum.description: PHY in Ultra Low Power state

bitfield.description: Automatic switch between ULP and ON states based on ULPM signals from PHY
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
+/- differential pin order of DATA lane 2.

Position and order of the DATA lane 2.Note:If the parallel camera sensor and the other camera sensor (CCP2 or CSI2) are connected to the same CSIPHY, the SCM.CONTROL_CAMERAx_PHY_CAMMOD bit must be set for CCP2 or CSI2mode, respectively, (even if only one pair is used as GPI for CPI mode). The corresponding DATAx_POSITION bit must be set to 0x0 for the lane in GPI mode. .
+/- differential pin order of DATA lane 1.

Position and order of the DATA lane 1.The data lane 1 is always present. . Note:If the parallel camera sensor and the other camera sensor (CCP2 or CSI2) are connected to the same CSIPHY, the SCM.CONTROL_CAMERAx_PHY_CAMMOD bit must be set for CCP2 or CSI2mode, respectively, (even if only one pair is used as GPI for CPI mode). The corresponding DATAx_POSITION bit must be set to 0x0 for the lane in GPI mode. . Note: The settings differ when using CSIPHY1/CSIPHY2 and CCP2. See , Camera ISP CSIPHY Initialization for Work With CSI1/CCP2B Receiver. .
±differential pin order of CLOCK lane.

Position and order of the CLOCK lane. The clock lane is always present.Note: The settings differ when using CSIPHY1/CSIPHY2 and CCP2. See , Camera ISP CSIPHY Initialization for Work With CSI1/CCP2B Receiver. .

bitenum.description: Clock lane is at position 2 (using CSIPHY1) or 1 (using CSIPHY2). This setting is valid for CCP2 receiver mode only.

register.description: DEBUG REGISTER (Payload) This register provides a way to debug the CSI2 RECEIVER module with no image sensor connected to the module. The debug mode is enabled by .DBG_EN. Only full 32-bit values shall be written. The register is used to write payload of long packets.

bitfield.description: 32-bit input value.

register.description: TIMING REGISTER This register controls the CSI2 RECEIVER module. This register shall not be modified while .IF_EN is set to '1'.It is used to indicate the number of L3 cycles for the Stop State monitoring.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Control of ForceRxMode signal

bitenum.description: De-assertion of ForceRxMode. The HW reset the bit at the end of the Force RX Mode assertion.The SW can reset the bit in order to stop the assertion of the ForceRXMode signal prior to the completion of the period.

bitfield.description: Multiplication factor for the number of L3 cycles defined in STOP_STATE_COUNTER_IO1 bit-field

bitenum.description: The number of L3 cycles defined in STOP_STATE _COUNTER_IO1 is multiplied by 1x
The number of L3 cycles defined in STOP_STATE _COUNTER_IO1 is multiplied by 16x

bitfield.description: Multiplication factor for the number of L3 cycles defined in STOP_STATE_COUNTER_IO1 bit-field

bitenum.description: The number of L3 cycles defined in STOP_STATE _COUNTER_IO1 is multiplied by 1x
The number of L3 cycles defined in STOP_STATE _COUNTER_IO1 is multiplied by 4x

bitfield.description: Stop State counter for monitoring. It indicates the number of L3 to monitor for Stop State before de-asserting ForceRxMode (Complex I/O #1).The value is from 0 to 8191.
